column3: This seems ok. I think it could make sense for `-nodatadir` and `-datadir=` on the command line to override any datadir string in the configuration file and override any datadir in qt settings, and use default platform datadir as if no value was ever specified. \n\nOr alternately, it could make sense for -nodatadir to print an error, because it's similar enough to -nowallet, -nowalletdir, -nopid
